segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager
segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Settings by Using the MED-V Workspace Packager

segment.source: You can use the MED-V Workspace Packager to manage certain settings in the MED-V workspace.
segment.target: You can use the MED-V Workspace Packager to manage certain settings in the MED-V workspace.

segment.source: To manage settings in a MED-V workspace
segment.target: To manage settings in a MED-V workspace

segment.source: To open the MED-V Workspace Packager, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Workspace Packager.
segment.target: To open the MED-V Workspace Packager, click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization, and then click MED-V Workspace Packager.

segment.source: On the MED-V Workspace Packager main panel, click Manage Settings.
segment.target: On the MED-V Workspace Packager main panel, click Manage Settings.

segment.source: In the Manage Settings window, you can configure the following MED-V workspace settings:
segment.target: In the Manage Settings window, you can configure the following MED-V workspace settings:

segment.source: Start MED-V workspace
segment.target: Start MED-V workspace

segment.source: Choose whether to start the MED-V workspace at user logon, at first use, or to let the end user decide when the MED-V workspace starts.
segment.target: Choose whether to start the MED-V workspace at user logon, at first use, or to let the end user decide when the MED-V workspace starts.

segment.source: The MED-V workspace starts in one of two ways: either when the end user logs on or when they first perform an action that requires MED-V, such as opening a published application or entering a URL that requires redirection.
segment.target: The MED-V workspace starts in one of two ways: either when the end user logs on or when they first perform an action that requires MED-V, such as opening a published application or entering a URL that requires redirection.

segment.source: You can either define this setting for the end user or let the end user control how MED-V starts.
segment.target: You can either define this setting for the end user or let the end user control how MED-V starts.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you specify that the end user decides, the default behavior they experience is that the MED-V workspace starts when they log on.
segment.target: If you specify that the end user decides, the default behavior they experience is that the MED-V workspace starts when they log on.

segment.source: They can change the default by right-clicking the MED-V icon in the notification area and selecting MED-V User Settings.
segment.target: They can change the default by right-clicking the MED-V icon in the notification area and selecting MED-V User Settings.

segment.source: If you define this setting for the end user, they cannot change the way in which MED-V starts.
segment.target: If you define this setting for the end user, they cannot change the way in which MED-V starts.

segment.source: Networking
segment.target: Networking

segment.source: Select Shared or Bridged for your networking setting.
segment.target: Select Shared or Bridged for your networking setting.

segment.source: The default is Shared.
segment.target: The default is Shared.

segment.source: Shared - The MED-V workspace uses Network Address Translation (NAT) to share the host's IP for outgoing traffic.
segment.target: Shared - The MED-V workspace uses Network Address Translation (NAT) to share the host's IP for outgoing traffic.

segment.source: Bridged - The MED-V workspace has its own network address, typically obtained through DHCP.
segment.target: Bridged - The MED-V workspace has its own network address, typically obtained through DHCP.

segment.source: Store credentials
segment.target: Store credentials

segment.source: Choose whether you want to store the end user credentials.
segment.target: Choose whether you want to store the end user credentials.

segment.source: The default behavior is that credential storing is disabled so that the end user must be authenticated every time that they log on.
segment.target: The default behavior is that credential storing is disabled so that the end user must be authenticated every time that they log on.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Even though caching the end user’s credentials provides the best user experience, you should be aware of the risks involved.
segment.target: Even though caching the end user’s credentials provides the best user experience, you should be aware of the risks involved.

segment.source: The end user’s domain credential is stored in a reversible format in the Windows Credential Manager.
segment.target: The end user’s domain credential is stored in a reversible format in the Windows Credential Manager.

segment.source: An attacker could write a program that retrieves the password and thus gain access to the user’s credentials.
segment.target: An attacker could write a program that retrieves the password and thus gain access to the user’s credentials.

segment.source: You can only lessen this risk by disabling the storing of end user credentials.
segment.target: You can only lessen this risk by disabling the storing of end user credentials.

segment.source: Click Save as…
segment.target: Click Save as…

segment.source: to save the updated configuration settings in the specified folder.
segment.target: to save the updated configuration settings in the specified folder.

segment.source: MED-V creates a registry file that contains the updated settings.
segment.target: MED-V creates a registry file that contains the updated settings.

segment.source: Deploy the updated registry file by using Group Policy.
segment.target: Deploy the updated registry file by using Group Policy.

segment.source: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).
segment.target: For more information about how to use Group Policy, see Group Policy Software Installation (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=195931).

segment.source: MED-V also creates a Windows PowerShell script in the specified folder that you can use to re-create this updated registry file.
segment.target: MED-V also creates a Windows PowerShell script in the specified folder that you can use to re-create this updated registry file.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Managing MED-V Workspace Configuration Settings
